You can create an TrueRange indicator object that is not bounded to any automatic update and choose which data it should use. To use it, please refer to the reference table below.

TrueRange()1/1

            TrueRange QuantConnect.Indicators.TrueRange (
    *string                       name,
    *Nullable<Resolution>  resolution,
    *Func<IBaseDataBar>    selector
   )

Creates a new TrueRange indicator.

Parameters
*string name (Optional) The custom name of the indicator whose TR we want.
*Nullable<Resolution> resolution (Optional) The resolution.
*Func<IBaseDataBar> selector (Optional) Selects a value from the BaseData to send into the indicator, if None defaults to the Value property of BaseData (x => x.Value).

Return

TrueRange - The TrueRange indicator for the requested name.

Definition at file Indicators/TrueRange.cs.


You can use two methods to update the indicator: automatic or manual.

Automatic Update

In this method, you will recreate the basic indicator usage: create the indicator with its constructor and register the indicator for automatic updates with the RegisterIndicator() method, but could be using a custom resolution via a Consolidator.

private TrueRange _tr;
// In Initialize()
_tr = new TrueRange();
_tr.Updated += IndicatorUpdateMethod;

var thirtyMinuteConsolidator = new TradeBarConsolidator(TimeSpan.FromMinutes(30));
SubscriptionManager.AddConsolidator(symbol, thirtyMinuteConsolidator);

RegisterIndicator(symbol, _tr, thirtyMinuteConsolidator);

// In IndicatorUpdateMethod()
if (_tr.IsReady)
{
    var indicatorValue = _tr.Current.Value;
}
# In Initialize()
self.tr = TrueRange()
self.tr.Updated += self.IndicatorUpdateMethod

thirty_minute_consolidator = TradeBarConsolidator(timedelta(minutes=30))
self.SubscriptionManager.AddConsolidator(symbol, thirty_minute_consolidator)

self.RegisterIndicator(symbol, self.tr, thirty_minute_consolidator)

# In IndicatorUpdateMethod()
if self.tr.IsReady:
    indicator_value = self.tr.Current.Value

Manual Update

Updating your indicator manually allows you to control which data is used and create indicators of other non-regular price fields. The indicator objects have the Update() method that updates the state of the TrueRange indicator with the given a trade bar, a quote bar, or a custom data bar.

With this method, the indicator will only be ready after the Update() method has been used to pump enough data.

private TrueRange _tr;
// In Initialize()
_tr = new TrueRange();

// In OnData()
if (data.QuoteBars.ContainsKey(symbol))
{
    _tr.Update(data.QuoteBars[symbol]);
}
if (_tr.IsReady)
{
    var indicatorValue = _tr.Current.Value;
}
# In Initialize()
self.tr = TrueRange()

# In OnData()
if data.QuoteBars.ContainsKey(symbol):
    self.tr.Update(data.QuoteBars[symbol])
if self.tr.IsReady:
    indicator_value = self.tr.Current.Value
